candidates.title: chore: release deno_http 0.8.0
candidates.body: Requested by @bnoordhuis, contains fixed resource leak (#11955)

candidates.title: feat: add URLPattern API
candidates.body:
This adds support for the URLPattern  API.

The API is added in --unstable only, as it has not yet shipped in any
browser. It is targeted for shipping in Chrome 95.

Spec: https://wicg.github.io/urlpattern/

Closes #11619

---

TODOs:
- [x] Add JSDoc comments to lib.deno_url.d.ts
- [x] Add a TypeScript unit test to validate typings.

candidates.title: refactor(lint): reuse lint rules
candidates.body:
This commit updated "deno_lint" crate to 0.15.1 and refactors
"cli/tools/lint.rs" to create only a single vector of lint rules,
instead of creating a vector for each linted file.

<s>Blocked by #11780</s>

candidates.title: feat(cli): Support Basic authentication in DENO_AUTH_TOKENS
candidates.body:
<!--
Before submitting a PR, please read http://deno.land/manual/contributing

1. Give the PR a descriptive title.

  Examples of good title:
    - fix(std/http): Fix race condition in server
    - docs(console): Update docstrings
    - feat(doc): Handle nested reexports

  Examples of bad title:
    - fix #7123
    - update docs
    - fix bugs

2. Ensure there is a related issue and it is referenced in the PR text.
3. Ensure there are tests that cover the changes.
4. Ensure `cargo test` passes.
5. Ensure `./tools/format.js` passes without changing files.
6. Ensure `./tools/lint.js` passes.
-->

Closes #11899 

I'm not sure on the naming of the `AuthTokenData` enum. Normally I would use the name `AuthToken`, but the name is already taken and I don't want to rename existing types.

candidates.title: feat(fmt): add basic JSDoc formatting
candidates.body:
This change is in preparation for the upcoming indentation width config, but also it's just a good overall change especially when a user is formatting with `deno fmt` for the first time (I wish we had this sooner as perhaps a lot of people trying out deno fmt in the past would have been annoyed at it not changing the indent for js docs).

By basic I mean this only formats the main area around JSDocs. It doesn't format tags or the inner parts of JS docs.

This change also makes markdown links stay on one line which helps with syntax highlighting.

candidates.title: fix(ext/ffi): don't panic on invalid enum values
candidates.body: This fixes #11741. It is an alternative to #11791 that doesn't add webidl things to Deno namespace APIs.

candidates.title: refactor(lsp): use deno_ast and cache swc ASTs
candidates.body:
This change integrates `deno_ast` and lazily caches/reuses swc AST in the language server.

I've yet to come up with a benchmark I think is worthwhile to have... given that swc is already so fast this change is only noticable with very large files. I would say this isn't so much a performance improvement, but rather just a refactoring.

Closes #11345
Closes #11854

candidates.title: perf(ext/url): cleanup and optimize url parsing op args
candidates.body:
This splits the previous `op_url_parse` into:
- `op_url_parse`: parses a href with an optional base
- `op_url_reparse`: reparses a href with a modifier

This is a cleaner separation of concerns and it allows us to optimize & simplify args passed. Resulting in a 25% reduction in call overhead (`~5000ns/call` => `~3700ns/call` in the `url_ops` bench on my M1 Air)

candidates.title: feat(unstable): Add file locking APIs
candidates.body:
Closes #11511

# ToDo
- [x] Add an async version (currently using tokio::task::spawn_blocking)
- [x] Add tests
- [x] Should any of these operations require write permissions (I would say read more appropriate, since the file is not actually changed and `flock` is only advisory)?
- [x] Is the create this is based on okay? This crate is the most well-maintained one which a low-level API I can find. Other crates have more recent version updates, but an RAII API that would require managing the RAII locks on the rust side...
